data.name: AssemblyMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes based on the assembly name or by specifying a reference to an assembly.

data.name: AssemblyMatchingRuleDataMatchDescription
data.value: The name of the assembly to match. It can be the name and version; the name, version and culture; or the full assembly name of the assembly excluding the .dll file name extension. It cannot include wildcard characters.

data.name: AssemblyMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Assembly Matching Rule.

data.name: AssemblyMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Assembly Matching Rule.

data.name: CallHandlerDataOrderDescription
data.value: The position of the handler within the policy handler chain, starting from 1. The default value is zero, which means that there is no explicit order specified for the handler in relation to other handlers in the same handler chain.

data.name: CustomAttributeMatchingRuleDataAttributeTypeNameDescription
data.value: The type name of the custom attribute that is applied to members of the target object.

data.name: CustomAttributeMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on a custom attribute type that is applied to class members.

data.name: CustomAttributeMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Custom Attribute Matching Rule.

data.name: CustomAttributeMatchingRuleDataSearchInheritanceChainDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the rule should also search base classes for members that carry the custom attribute.

data.name: CustomAttributeMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Custom Attribute Matching Rule.

data.name: CustomCallHandlerDataDescription
data.value: A custom implementation of a Call Handler that is added to Enterprise Library.

data.name: CustomCallHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Custom Call Handler.

data.name: CustomMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A custom implementation of a Matching Rule that is added to Enterprise Library.

data.name: CustomMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Custom Matching Rule.

data.name: CustomMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Custom Matching Rule.

data.name: ExceptionCallHandlerDataDescription
data.value: A Call Handler that provides the capability to manage and process exceptions in a standard way. This handler uses the Exception Handling Application Block to handle exceptions raised by the target object.

data.name: ExceptionCallHandlerDataExceptionPolicyNameDescription
data.value: The name of the exception handling policy to use, as configured in the Exception Handling Application Block.

data.name: ExceptionCallHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Exception Handling Call Handler.

data.name: ExceptionCallHandlerDataOrderDescription
data.value: The position of the handler within the policy handler chain, starting from 1. The default value is zero, which means that there is no explicit order specified for the handler in relation to other handlers in the same handler chain.

data.name: ExceptionCallHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Exception Handling Call Handler.

data.name: LogCallHandlerCategoryEntryDescription
data.value: A single Category in the list of Categories for the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerCategoryEntryNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Category Entry.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataAfterMessageDescription
data.value: The message that the Logging Handler will add to the log entry after the target method executes.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataBeforeMessageDescription
data.value: The message that the Logging Handler will add to the log entry before the target method executes.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataCategoriesDescription
data.value: The list of categories to which the Logging Handler will write events. Each category can be a literal value, and/or include the tokens {method}, {type}, {namespace}, and {assembly}.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataDescription
data.value: A Call Handler that provides the capability to write log messages and trace messages as the client code invokes the selected method or accesses the selected property of the target object. This handler uses the Logging Application Block to create and write log messages.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataEventIdDescription
data.value: The ID of the event to include in the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataIncludeCallStackDescription
data.value: Determines whether the call stack will be included in the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataIncludeCallTimeDescription
data.value: Determines whether the duration of the call will be included in After Message section of the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataIncludeParameterValuesDescription
data.value: Determines whether the values of the parameters passed to the target method will be included in the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataLogBehaviorDescription
data.value: Determines if the handler will write log messages before, after, or both before and after the call to the target object. A value from the HandlerLogBehavior enumeration. Valid values are Before, After, and BeforeAndAfter.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Logging Call Handler.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataOrderDescription
data.value: The position of the handler within the policy handler chain, starting from 1. The default value is zero, which means that there is no explicit order specified for the handler in relation to other handlers in the same handler chain.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataPriorityDescription
data.value: The priority value of the exception to include in the log message.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataSeverityDescription
data.value: The severity value of the exception to include in the log message; using values from the TraceEventType enumeration such as Critical, Error, and Warning.

data.name: LogCallHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Logging Call Handler.

data.name: MatchDataCollectionDescription
data.value: A collection of matches for a Matching Rule.

data.name: MatchDataDescription
data.value: A class that holds information about a single match for a Matching Rule, such as the string to match and whether the match is case-sensitive.

data.name: MatchDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: MatchDataMatchDescription
data.value: The string value the Matching Rule will compare to class, member, or parameter names.

data.name: MatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A base class for all Matching Rules.

data.name: MatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Matching Rule.

data.name: MatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Matching Rule.

data.name: MemberNameMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the names of the class members (methods or properties). Wildcard characters can be used for the member name.

data.name: MemberNameMatchingRuleDataMatchesDescription
data.value: The collection of method and property names to match. Wildcard characters can be included.

data.name: MemberNameMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Member Name Matching Rule.

data.name: MemberNameMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Member Name Matching Rule.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the name and signature (the list of parameter types) of its members. This rule allows the use of wildcard characters for the member names.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataMatchDescription
data.value: The name of the method to match. Wildcard characters can be included.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Method Signature Matching Rule.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataParametersDescription
data.value: The collection of parameter type names (not the parameter names) that make up the matching method signature.

data.name: MethodSignatureMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Method Signature Matching Rule.

data.name: NamespaceMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on their namespace name, using wildcard characters for the child namespace names but not for the root namespace name.

data.name: NamespaceMatchingRuleDataMatchesDescription
data.value: The collection of namespaces to match. Wildcard characters can be used for the child namespace names but not for the root namespace name.

data.name: NamespaceMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Namespace Matching Rule.

data.name: NamespaceMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Namespace Matching Rule.

data.name: ParameterTypeElementDataCollectionDescription
data.value: The collection of parameter types to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name. Each match also specifies whether the match is case-sensitive, and the parameter kind (which must be one of Input, Output, InputOrOutput, and ReturnValue).

data.name: ParameterTypeElementDescription
data.value: The type name, case-sensitivity, and usage for an individual parameter type to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name.

data.name: ParameterTypeElementNameDescription
data.value: A unique ID for this parameter. This name does not need to match the corresponding parameter in the target types; only the type is used.

data.name: ParameterTypeElementParameterTypeNameDescription
data.value: An individual parameter type to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchDataDescription
data.value: The type name, case-sensitivity, and usage for an individual parameter type to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchDataMatchDescription
data.value: An individual parameter type to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchDataParameterKindDescription
data.value: The usage of the parameter as a value from the ParameterKind enumeration. Valid values are Input, Output, InputOrOutput, and ReturnValue.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the type name of a parameter for a member of the target object.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchingRuleDataMatchesDescription
data.value: The collection of parameter types to match. The type name can be a fully qualified type name or just the class name. Each match also specifies whether the match is case-sensitive, and the parameter kind (which must be one of Input, Output, InputOrOutput, and ReturnValue).

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Parameter Type Matching Rule.

data.name: ParameterTypeMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Parameter Type Matching Rule.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataCategoryNameDescription
data.value: The name of the category of the target performance counter.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataDescription
data.value: A Call Handler that increments a specific counter each time it executes in response to invocation of the selected method or setting of the selected property. This handler uses the instrumentation features that are part of the Enterprise Library Core.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataIncrementAverageCallDurationDescription
data.value: Whether to increment an 'Average duration of each call' counter each time.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataIncrementCallsPerSecondDescription
data.value: Whether to increment a 'Number of calls per second' counter each time.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataIncrementExceptionsPerSecondDescription
data.value: Whether to increment a 'Number of exceptions per second' counter each time.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataIncrementNumberOfCallsDescription
data.value: Whether to increment a 'Total number of calls' counter each time.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataIncrementTotalExceptionsDescription
data.value: Whether to increment a 'Total number of exceptions' counter each time.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataInstanceNameDescription
data.value: The name of the instance of the target performance counter. Can include the tokens {method}, {type}, {namespace}, {assembly}, and {appdomain}.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Performance Counter Call Handler.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataOrderDescription
data.value: The position of the handler within the policy handler chain, starting from 1. The default value is zero, which means that there is no explicit order specified for the handler in relation to other handlers in the same handler chain.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Performance Counter Call Handler.

data.name: PerformanceCounterCallHandlerDataUseTotalCounterDescription
data.value: Whether to increment a 'Total' counter each time.

data.name: PolicyDataDescription
data.value: A set of Matching Rules that select types and their members, and a set of Call Handlers that will execute when calls are made to these types and their members.

data.name: PolicyDataHandlersDescription
data.value: The set of Call Handlers for this Policy.

data.name: PolicyDataMatchingRulesDescription
data.value: The set of Matching Rules for this Policy.

data.name: PolicyInjectionSettingsDescription
data.value: Configuration settings for the Policy Injection Application Block.

data.name: PolicyInjectionSettingsPoliciesDescription
data.value: The set of Policies configured for the Policy Injection Application Block.

data.name: PropertyMatchDataDescription
data.value: A class that contains details of a property to match. It includes the property name, whether the match is case-sensitive, and a value from the PropertyMatchingOption enumeration that indicates if the rule should match on the Get, Set, or both the accessors for a selected parameter. Valid values for this are Get, Set, and GetOrSet.

data.name: PropertyMatchDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: PropertyMatchDataMatchDescription
data.value: The name of a property to match. It can include or consist of the * or ? wildcard characters to select multiple properties, and may use square brackets [ ] to specify a range of characters.

data.name: PropertyMatchDataMatchOptionDescription
data.value: A value from the PropertyMatchingOption enumeration that indicates if the rule should match on the Get, Set, or both the accessors for a selected parameter. Valid values are Get, Set, and GetOrSet.

data.name: PropertyMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on their name, including using wildcard characters, and the combination of accessors they implement.

data.name: PropertyMatchingRuleDataMatchesDescription
data.value: The collection of match details containing the property names, case-sensitivity, and accessor details to match.

data.name: PropertyMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Property Matching Rule.

data.name: PropertyMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Property Matching Rule.

data.name: ReturnTypeMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the type of the return value.

data.name: ReturnTypeMatchingRuleDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: ReturnTypeMatchingRuleDataMatchDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the type of the return value of the method to match, or just the type name.

data.name: ReturnTypeMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Return Type Matching Rule.

data.name: ReturnTypeMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Return Type Matching Rule.

data.name: StringBasedMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A base class for Matching Rules that selects target classes and class members using string matches.

data.name: StringBasedMatchingRuleDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: StringBasedMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the String Based Matching Rule.

data.name: StringBasedMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the String Based Matching Rule.

data.name: TagAttributeMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the name of an attribute of type Tag that is applied to a class, or to members (methods or properties) within a class.

data.name: TagAttributeMatchingRuleDataIgnoreCaseDescription
data.value: Specifies whether the match should be carried out on a case-sensitive basis. The default is false.

data.name: TagAttributeMatchingRuleDataMatchDescription
data.value: The name of the Tag attribute applied to the target object. It cannot include wildcard characters.

data.name: TagAttributeMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Tag Attribute Matching Rule.

data.name: TagAttributeMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Tag Attribute Matching Rule.

data.name: TypeMatchingRuleDataDescription
data.value: A Matching Rule that selects target classes and class members based on the namespace and class name of the target type.

data.name: TypeMatchingRuleDataMatchesDescription
data.value: The collection of matches for types, including the type name and the case sensitivity. The type name may include the full namespace and class name of the target object, or just the class name.

data.name: TypeMatchingRuleDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Type Matching Rule.

data.name: TypeMatchingRuleDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Type Matching Rule.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataDescription
data.value: A Call Handler that provides the capability to test whether the value provided for the selected property, or the values specified for the parameters of the selected method, are valid against specific rules. This handler uses the Validation Application Block to perform the validation.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Validation Call Handler.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataOrderDescription
data.value: The position of the handler within the policy handler chain, starting from 1. The default value is zero, which means that there is no explicit order specified for the handler in relation to other handlers in the same handler chain.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataRuleSetDescription
data.value: The name of the rule set to use for all target object types, as configured in the Validation Application Block. An empty string causes the handler to use the default rule set.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataSpecificationSourceDescription
data.value: A value from the SpecificationSource enumeration that defines the locations where the handler will look for validation rules. Valid values are Attributes, Configuration, ParameterAttributesOnly, and Both.

data.name: ValidationCallHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Validation Call Handler.
